decks.notes: This deck revolves around utilizing graveyard synergies and sacrificing creatures to bring back Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis quickly and efficiently. It focuses on filling the graveyard with creatures using self-mill effects like Stitcher's Supplier and Satyr Wayfinder, while also running cards like Gravecrawler and Bloodghast that can recur from the graveyard easily. The deck aims to create a strong board presence and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality. It also includes cards like Lotleth Troll and Assassin's Trophy to handle threats and ensure the deck can stay ahead in the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing a wide array of versatile creatures and spells to apply pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By combining the aggressive nature of the partner commanders Thrasios, Triton Hero and Tymna the Weaver with a toolbox of creatures and tutors, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and control the game through creature synergy and removal spells. The inclusion of various mana dorks and ramp spells ensures a smooth and consistent mana curve, enabling powerful plays with cards like Birthing Pod and Aluren. The deck's mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells and creatures, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and maximizing efficiency.

The deck revolves around utilizing Sai, Master Thopterist to generate a swarm of Thopter tokens while also controlling the board with a variety of disruptive artifacts and counter spells. The deck focuses on deploying artifacts quickly and efficiently, using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Chief Engineer to ramp and recur key pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient artifact creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Master of Etherium, alongside powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. The deck's strategy is to maintain board presence, disrupt opponents' plans, and ultimately out-value them with a combination of card advantage and synergy between artifacts.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence by casting artifacts and creating Thopter tokens with Sai, Master Thopterist. It aims to control the game by disrupting opponents' strategies with counterspells and disrupting their mana base. The deck also includes various artifact synergies to generate value and improve its board presence, such as Urza, Lord High Artificer and Retrofitter Foundry. It can also switch to an aggressive strategy with cards like True-Name Nemesis and Arcbound Ravager to quickly close out games. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its synergistic artifact strategy while using disruption to control the pace of the game.

The deck revolves around utilizing Brago, King Eternal's ability to flicker permanents, allowing for repeated value from cards like Parallax Wave, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Detention Sphere. The goal is to control the board through counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, along with removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Council's Judgment. Card advantage is gained through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Recruiter of the Guard, and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also aims to disrupt opponents with Meddling Mage and Spellskite while setting up a win condition with True-Name Nemesis and creatures equipped with Umezawa's Jitte. Overall, the strategy focuses on controlling the game and outvaluing opponents through efficient resource management.

The deck revolves around utilizing Kess, Dissident Mage's ability to recast instants and sorceries from the graveyard to control the game. It includes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, card draw, and planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own. The deck aims to control the board and hand, depleting the opponent's resources while generating card advantage and maintaining a strong board presence. By efficiently using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Liliana of the Veil, and Nicol Bolas, the Ravager, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win the game through incremental advantage and disruption. It leverages Kess's unique ability to cast powerful spells multiple times to maintain board control and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between the commanders, Sidar Kondo and Thrasios, to create a fast and aggressive gameplay style. The deck includes a variety of creatures, spells, and tutors to consistently put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their strategy. By combining cards that provide mana acceleration, card draw, and protection, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of partner commanders allows for flexibility in adapting to different situations and maximizing the effectiveness of each card played. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to create a well-balanced aggro strategy that can outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a Duel Commander format.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to get Titania, Protector of Argoth onto the battlefield as soon as possible. Utilizing various mana dorks and ramp spells, the deck aims to flood the board with lands and create a constant stream of Elemental tokens with Titania's ability. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Primeval Titan and Tireless Tracker to further ramp and generate value from the lands entering the battlefield. The inclusion of utility lands like Glacial Chasm and Wasteland adds versatility and disruption against opponents. Overall, the key strategy of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a high number of powerful creatures and mana advantage.
